attributes.action: Bring about the re-establishment of a devolved English Parliament and Government
attributes.additional_details:
there is currently a massive gaping hole in the combined British constitution which has left England as a constituent country out to dry...
Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland are all in control of devolved governments that allow for them to rule on "Non-Reserved" matters outside of the HOC or HOL. there is no good reason why England shall not be afforded the same courtesy as its fellow constituent country's in the wider union.
attributes.background: Re-establish a devolved English Government- with the same powers as the Parlamaid Na h-Alba or Northern Ireland Assembly. And of course to have a *non-regionalized* devolved English government in conjunction with the previously proposed legislature.

rejection.details:
The following petition calls for a similar action: 

Allow England to have a devolved parliament
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/707102
